Comments_List: I gained insight into the possible motivating factors of terrorism and relevant foreign policy.
Interesting seminar. Predominantly covers Jihadist, Irish and alt-right terrorism and extremism and the reasons why individuals turn to terrorism.
This course provided remarkable insight into the intersection of terrorism with a variety of different subfields, such as the motivations behind terrorism, the media, civil rights, and intelligence.
learned about how we define terrorism, different causes of terrorism, and evaluated case studies in terrorism
I better understanding of what causes people to resort to terrorism and how it can be seen as a useful tactic to some organizations.

The course was really great in that it had fantastic readings, great class discussion, and wonderful guest speakers. I thought the readings selected were all extremely interesting and provoked a lot of great discussion in class. Further, the guest speakers that Professor Weir brought in provided so many different facets to our conversation, giving us a personal deep dive into the material that cannot be found anywhere else. I also liked how the assessments were of different varieties, from presentations to speaker responses to the final paper--playing to the strengths of all sorts of students.
great course. AMAZING guest speakers and readings
Yes -- the course material is really interesting, and Professor Weir brings in many insightful speakers throughout the semester!
Yes, Professor Weir is an interesting lecturer and classes were engaging.

I would definitely recommend this course to anyone who is interested in exploring the subject of terrorism, as well as how it relates to other fields. Professor Weir is incredibly knowledgeable about this material and is someone who can help us digest the complex information we are talking about into more understandable terms. The class discussions and guest speakers were extremely thought provoking, and I am so grateful for the opportunities I have had in this class.
